cardregister

Class Card

  • java.lang.Object
    • cardregister.Card

  • public class Card
extends java.lang.Object
    This class represents information about books in cards. Cards contain information in an array of strings called content[]. The constant integers starting " LABEL_" tell what information the corresponding content-string contains. Thus content[LABEL_ISBN] contains the book's ISBN-number, for example. Constant NUMBER_OF_FIELDS tells how many text fields there are in a card. The string array labels tells what the corresponding fields should be called by the UI. In Finnish UI for example, it will be labels[LABEL_AUTHOR] = "Tekij√§". Finally, the boolean array cardsEquals tells which fields need to be the same for two cards to be same (or relatively same, depending on how the other classes want to use this). For example, if cardsEquals[LABEL_TITLE] == cardsEquals[LABEL_TITLE] == true, and every other element is false, then the cards are deemed to be equal if and only if they have the same content (case and extra emptyspace insensitive).

    • Method Detail

      • contentEqualsTo

        public boolean contentEqualsTo(java.lang.String[] text)
        tells if the card's content is the same as the given array of strings. This method is insensitive to capital/small letters and emptyspaces at the beginning or end of the string. Thus field " SOme text here" is considered to equal the field "some text HERE". This method can be used to find a card whose identity is unknown, but content known. When doing so, it's important not to have two different cards with the same content.
        Parameters:
        text - The content this card is being compared to.
        Returns:
        True if the cards equal as told above, false otherwise.

      • fieldsInclude

        public boolean fieldsInclude(java.lang.String[] text)
        Compares the input to the content of the card. In order to pass this, the content of each text field in this card must contain as a substring the given Strings. The comparison is not case sensitive and it trims away emptyspaces at the end and beginning of each string.
        Parameters:
        text - The Strings that are searched from the content of this card.
        Returns:
        True if all the fields contain the searched Strings, False if one or more searchAnyField words aren't found.

      • getContent

        public java.lang.String[] getContent()
        Returns the content of this card as an array of strings.
        Returns:
        The content.

      • getLabels

        public static java.lang.String[] getLabels()
        The names of the text fields as they are meant to be displayed to the user.
        Returns:
        The names of the text fields as displayed to the user..

      • isRelativelyEqualTo

        public boolean isRelativelyEqualTo(java.lang.String[] comparedTo)
        Tells whether this card is or is not "relatively equal" to a given card's data. The fields that count towards two cards being relatively equal are specified by the constant equalsTo of this class. If equalsTo[i] == true, the i:th field has an effect, and otherwise it does not. For the fields that matter the comparision is case insensitive and ignores emptyspaces at the end and beginning of the strings.
        Parameters:
        comparedTo - The content of the card this is being compared to.
        Returns:
        True if the cards are relatively equal (as explained above), false otherwise.

      • searchAnyField

        public boolean searchAnyField(java.lang.String search)
        Searches from every field of this card. If any of this card's fields contain the search word (trimmed and case insensitive), this returns true.
        Parameters:
        search - The word to be searched.
        Returns:
        True if the search word is contained in some of the fields of this card. False otherwise.

      • setContent

        public void setContent(java.lang.String[] newContent)
        Sets a new content to this card.
        Parameters:
        newContent - The new content.
